conclusion: Need to calculate the area under the velocity-time graph for the interval 10 to 15 seconds to determine the distance fallen.
At t = 10 seconds, the velocity v1 = 20 m/s. At t = 15 seconds, the velocity v2 = 10 m/s.
The graph shows a linear decrease in velocity, forming a trapezoid between t = 10 s to t = 15 s.
The formula for the area of a trapezoid is: Area = 1/2 * (Base1 + Base2) * Height.
Base1 = v1 = 20 m/s, Base2 = v2 = 10 m/s, and Height = Î”t = 15 - 10 = 5 seconds.
Substitute the values into the formula: Area = 1/2 * (20 + 10) * 5 = 75 meters.
The area under the graph is exactly 75 meters, which corresponds to the distance fallen during the interval.
The distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is exactly 75 meters, which means it is not greater than 75 meters.
